intro: Thlaspi thlaspidioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, perennial herb characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in early spring. It is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils in alpine and arctic regions. Thlaspi thlaspidioides is adapted to harsh environmental conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
